column2: Blood of the mythical founder Go Chumo who established Goguryeo, conquered his neighbors, defeated foreign invaders, and was deified by his people.
Blood of the legendary philosopher and politician Kong Fuzi who founded Confucianism and whose political theories and philosophies guide kings and emperors.
Blood of the mighty Kujula Kadphises who unified the five great Yuezhi clans, conquered kingdoms, and established the Kushan Empire.
Blood of the legendary philosopher Laozi who founded Taoism, purportedly wrote the Dao De Jing, and whose teachings have been deified as divine.
Blood of the great founder Liu Bang who rose up from humble beginnings to conquer and unify China and eventually establish the great Han Dynasty.
Blood of the famous commander Ma Yuan who protected the Han Dynasty's frontiers, maintained loyalty, and subdued the Nanyue, Qiang, and Bandunman.
Blood of the legendary general Sun Zi who famously wrote the Art of War which has defined military strategy for centuries.
Blood of the famous politician Yuan An who defended Han Imperial authority and who unsuccessfully advocated for diplomacy with the Xiongnu rather than war.
